name: Focaccia Bread
author: Terri McCarrell
summary: A wonderful, quick alternative to garlic bread. Lots of herbs and lots of flavor!
directions: In a large bowl, stir together the flour, salt, sugar, yeast, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, basil and black pepper
Mix in the vegetable oil and water
When the dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead until smooth and elastic
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, and turn to coat with oil
Cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for 20 minutes
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Punch dough down; place on greased baking sheet
Pat into a 1/2 inch thick rectangle
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown
